attributes.action: make it unlawful to enforce any penalty for a parking offence unless the penalty charge notice was physically attached to the offending vehicle while the offence was being committed.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently over 50% of tickets challenged in England & Wales (75% in London) are found to have been issued incorrectly, or are not even contested by the issuing authority.  

Authorities are now attempting to bring in "parking ticket by camera" enforcement, meaning that authorities can deliver parking tickets by post rather than at the scene of the offence. 

This will deprive motorists of the ability to collect evidence about an incorrectly issued parking ticket upon returning to their vehicle. 

This proposed "ticket by camera" enforcement will open the door to further fraudulent ticket-issuing by revenue-seeking authorities. 

The "ticket by camera "proposal has already been criticised by the AA.
